Description: IF AWARDED A  300K GRANT FROM THE DIVISION OF ENERGY AND MINERALS DEVELOPMENT OF THE BUREAU OF INDIAN AFFAIRS, THE OSAGE MINERALS COUNCIL WILL CONDUCT A 12-MONTH PROJECT TO DEVELOP THE ORGANIZATIONAL AND BUSINESS, LEGAL AND REGULATORY INFRASTRUCTURES TO REGULATE AND MANAGE THE OSAGE NATIONS (NATION) ENERGY AND MINERAL RESOURCES. THESE PROVISIONS WILL SAFEGUARD THE NATIONS RESOURCE DEVELOPMENT BUSINESS AND ENABLE THE OMC TO LEAD PATHWAYS TO THE HIGHEST AND BEST USES OF THE NATIONS MINERAL ESTATE.THE OSAGE NATION, A FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED TRIBE WHOSE 1.47 MILLION-ACRE RESERVATION IS COMMENSURATE WITH THE BOUNDARIES OF CURRENT-DAY OSAGE COUNTY, OKLAHOMA, IS THE BENEFICIAL OWNER OF THE OIL AND GAS AND OTHER MINERALS SUBSURFACE IN THE COUNTY. THE OMC ADMINISTERS AND DEVELOPS THE MINERALS ESTATE AND HAS FUNCTIONED PRIMARILY UNDER THE GUIDELINES ESTABLISHED BY FEDERAL REGULATIONS OF TRIBAL OIL AND GAS MINING AND ASSOCIATED LEASES.UNLIKE OTHER MINERAL RESOURCE TRIBES, THE OSAGE NATION HAS NEVER DEVELOPED A TRIBAL BUSINESS ENTITY CHARGED WITH EVALUATING AND IMPLEMENTING BUSINESS PRACTICES TO ENHANCE THE BENEFITS TO THE NATION AND THE SHAREHOLDERS OF THE MINERAL ESTATE. AS A RESULT, THE NATION IS NOT BENEFITTING FROM THE FULL VALUE OF ITS RESOURCES.THE OBJECTIVES SET FORTH BELOW WILL CREATE THE INFRASTRUCTURE NECESSARY TO IMPROVE THE DEVELOPMENT AND MANAGEMENT OF OSAGE MINERAL AND ENERGY RESOURCES. BUSINESS ENTITY AND STRUCTURE: DEVELOP AND ESTABLISH UNDER TRIBAL LAW AN ENERGY-FOCUSED BUSINESS ENTITY AND STRUCTURE CHARGED TO EVALUATE PRESENT AND FUTURE TRIBAL ENERGY BUSINESS OPPORTUNITIES, CONDUCT MARKET STUDY OF BEST BUSINESS PRACTICES, AND IMPLEMENT APPROPRIATE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES. REGULATORY ENTITY AND STRUCTURE: DEVELOP OMC AND OSAGE CODES AND REGULATIONS RELATED TO MINERAL AND ENERGY RESOURCES DEVELOPMENT, LEASING REQUIREMENTS, AND SAFEGUARDS FOR BUSINESS OPERATION. STRATEGIC BUSINESS PLAN: BASED ON THE ANALYSIS OF EXISTING RESOURCES, EVALUATE OPPORTUNITIES FOR DIVERSIFICATION IN MINERAL AND ENERGY OPERATIONS BY DEVELOPING ADDITIONAL RESOURCES, INCLUDING HYDROGEN, CARBON SEQUESTRATION, AGGREGATES, CLEAN ENERGY, ETC., THROUGH A STRATEGIC BUSINESS PLAN COMPATIBLE WITH NEW BUSINESS AND REGULATORY ENTITIES AND STRUCTURES. LEGISLATION: DEVELOPMENT OF OSAGE LEGISLATION NECESSARY TO ACCOMPLISH THE ABOVE OBJECTIVES.THE NATION ANTICIPATES THAT UPON COMPLETING THIS PROJECT (PHASE I), LED BY WAMPWORX ENERGY, WITH SOVEREIGN RESILIENCY PARTNERS, IT WILL HAVE DEVELOPED THE FOUNDATION FOR THE LEGAL AND BUSINESS INFRASTRUCTURE NEEDED TO ENHANCE TRIBAL SOVEREIGNTY AND SELF-DETERMINATION BY DIMINISHING RELIANCE ON GOVERNMENT OVERSIGHT. PHASE I SETS THE FOUNDATION FOR REGULARIZED BUSINESS PRACTICES SO THE OMC CAN THEN FOCUS ON CAPACITY BUILDING AND BUSINESS AND MARKET ANALYSIS. OMC CAN BUILD UPON PHASE I TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT A COMPLETE, MORE INDEPENDENT STRUCTURE AND SEEK THE APPROPRIATE FEDERAL APPROVALS IN A PHASE II PROGRAM.

STANDING ROCK SIOUX TRIBE (SRST) IS SEEKING FUNDING ON BEHALF OF THE STANDING ROCK ( SAGE ) RENEWABLE ENERGY POWER AUTHORITY TO CONTRACT THE DEVELOPMENT OF A TECHNICAL ROADMAP FOR SAGE TO BUILD THE CAPACITY NECESSARY TO EVENTUALLY SERVE THE SRST AS A DISTRIBUTION CAPABLE TRIBAL UTILITY AUTHORITY (TUA). SAGE IS A FEDERALLY CHARTERED SECTION 17 CORPORATION APPROVED BY THE U.S. SECRETARY OF THE INTERIOR. THE OBJECTIVE OF STANDING ROCK (SAGE) RENEWABLE ENERGY POWER AUTHORITY CAPACITY BUILDING PROPOSAL IS TO ASSESS HOW SAGE CAN INCREMENTALLY BUILD INSTITUTIONAL CAPACITY WITH THE AIM OF EVENTUALLY BECOMING A DISTRIBUTION CAPABLE TUA THAT COVERS PART OR ALL THE SRST RESERVATION. IN THE NEAR TERM, SAGE HAS IDENTIFIED TWO PRIMARY OPPORTUNITIES TO BUILD THEIR INSTITUTIONAL CAPACITY. FIRST, SAGE IS INTERESTED IN MANAGING RENEWABLE ENERGY DEVELOPMENT PROJECTS AND ASSETS, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE 235 MEGAWATT (MW) ANPETU WI WIND FARM IN DEVELOPMENT. SECOND, SAGE IS INTERESTED IN TAKING OVER THE BACK OFFICE BILLING FUNCTIONS FROM THE LOCAL UTILITY, MOR GRAN SOU (MGS) ELECTRIC COOPERATIVE, ON THE SRST RESERVATION, WHICH STRADDLES THE BORDER BETWEEN NORTH AND SOUTH DAKOTA.THIS PROPOSAL AIMS TO INCREASE SAGES CAPACITY THROUGH COMPLETING THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES  1) ASSESS THE CURRENT STATE OF ENERGY RESOURCES, ENERGY INFRASTRUCTURE, AND UTILITY SERVICES ON THE RESERVATION  2) EVALUATE THE CAPACITY FOR SAGE TO MANAGE RENEWABLE ENERGY DEVELOPMENT PROJECTS AND ASSETS  AND 3) DEVELOP A ROADMAP FOR TAKING OVER THE BACK OFFICE BILLING FUNCTIONS FROM THE LOCAL UTILITY. THIS CAPACITY BUILDING PROJECT WILL HELP SAGE TAKE THE FIRST STEPS NECESSARY TO SUCCESSFULLY MANAGE THE BACK OFFICE BILLINGS FUNCTIONS OF THE LOCAL UTILITY, AS WELL AS ENABLE SAGE TO HAVE A PLATFORM TO DEVELOP AND MANAGE RENEWABLE ENERGY PROJECTS IN BOTH THE NEAR AND LONG TERM. DEVELOPING A ROADMAP TO BUILD CAPACITY AS A TUA WITH DISTRIBUTION CAPABILITIES WILL ENABLE THE RESERVATION TO DEVELOP MORE ENERGY RESOURCES AND FURTHER TAKE CONTROL OF THEIR ENERGY FUTURE. THIS WILL IN TURN CREATE WELL PAYING JOB OPPORTUNITIES FOR TRIBAL MEMBERS AND WORK TO REDUCE THE COST OF ENERGY ON THE SRST RESERVATION WHILE INCREASING TRIBAL SOVEREIGNTY.

THE TRIBE HAS COMPLETED ONE TUA STUDY AND IS IN THE PROCESS OF COMPLETING THE SECOND. DURING THE FIRST TWO PHASES, ENERGY USAGE WAS ANALYZED TO UNDERSTAND THE ENERGY REQUIREMENTS FOR EACH OF THE  RESERVATIONS.  THE  LEGAL  AND  REGULATORY  ASPECTS  OF  INSTITUTING  A  TRIBAL  UTILITY  AUTHORITY WERE STUDIED AND SHOWED THE TRIBE IS IN A GOOD POSITION TO MOVE FORWARD WITH A TUA. AN ORGANIZATIONAL ASSESSMENT SHOWED THE TRIBE HAS THE EXPERTISE TO OWN AND OPERATE A UTILITY, THOUGH IT WILL NEED TO HIRE  EXPERTS  AT  CERTAIN  MANAGERIAL  LEVELS  WITH  EXPERIENCE  IN  THE  ELECTRIC  DISTRIBUTION  INDUSTRY. OVERALL,  A  READINESS  ASSESSMENT  SHOWED  THE  TRIBE  IS  ALMOST  READY TO  PROCEED  WITH  A  NEED  TO DETERMINE HOW THE PROJECT WOULD BE FINANCED. ANOTHER PRODUCT OF THE STUDIES IS A ROADMAP OF THE STEPS NEEDED TO PROCEED WITH IMPLEMENTING A TUA. THE CURRENT FEASIBILITY STUDY CONTINUES THE STEPS IDENTIFIED IN THE ROADMAP.TEDC GRANT FUNDS WILL SUPPORT THE TRIBE IN (1) DRAFTING THE CHARTER FOR ESTABLISHING THE TUA, AND (2) NEGOTIATING A WHOLESALE POWER PURCHASING CONTRACT FOR ONE OF THE RESERVATIONS.

THE LITTLE RIVER BAND OF OTTAWA INDIANS (LRBOI OR THE TRIBE) IS SEEKING TEDC FUNDING FOR ITS PROJECT TITLED LRBOI TRIBAL UTILITY AUTHORITY FEASIBILITY STUDY. THE PROPOSED PROJECT BUILDS OFF RECENT WORK THE TRIBE HAS COMPLETED RELATED TO RENEWABLE ENERGY PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT. LRBOI SEEKS TO CONSTRUCT VALUABLE RENEWABLE PROJECTS AND HAS EVIDENCE THAT A TRIBAL UTILITY AUTHORITY (TUA) MAY BE AN ATTRACTIVE ORGANIZATIONAL STRATEGY TO PLAN, FUND, BUILD, AND MANAGE THE ASSOCIATED ENERGY INFRASTRUCTURE. ALTHOUGH THERE SEEMS TO BE POTENTIAL, THE TRIBE NEEDS TO PERFORM A DETAILED EVALUATION TO DETERMINE IF A TUA IS RECOMMENDED. THE STUDY WOULD IDENTIFY TUA ALTERNATIVES, EVALUATE THE DETAILED TECHNICAL, ECONOMIC, AND LEGAL REGULATORY CONSIDERATIONS OF EACH ALTERNATIVE, DEVELOP TUA STRATEGY RECOMMENDATIONS, AND THEN PREPARE THE TRIBE FOR A SEAMLESS TRANSITION TO THE FORMATION PHASE.

THIS PROJECT STUDY AND REGULATORY REVIEW HAS THE POTENTIAL TO HELP THE MENOMINEE INDIAN TRIBE OF WISCONSIN IN MATTERS OF ECONOMIC BENEFITS, LOGISTICAL POWER IMPROVEMENTS FOR THE LAND, AND EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES THAT ARE LONG TERM AND CONSIST OF QUALITY JOBS.

RENO SPARKS INDIAN COLONYS (RSICS) TRANSACTIONAL CODE, HUNGRY VALLEY TRIBAL UTILITY AUTHORITY, AND RENO GOVERNMENT COMPLEX PROJECT WILL BUILD RSICS CAPACITY FOR ENERGY RESOURCE REGULATION AND GOVERNANCE. THIS PROJECT WILL CONDUCT A FEASIBILITY STUDY INTO DEVELOPING AN RSIC TRIBAL UTILITY AUTHORITY (TUA), WHICH IS A CHARTERED TRIBAL ENTITY CAPABLE OF INTERFACING WITH LOCAL UTILITIES, STATE AND FEDERAL AGENCIES, AND THE RSIC COMMUNITY TO ENSURE AFFORDABLE, RELIABLE ENERGY. THIS PROJECT WILL DEVELOP THE ORGANIZATIONAL AND REGULATORY CAPACITY NECESSARY FOR THE TUA, INCLUDING TRANSACTIONAL CODES FOR UTILITY DISTRIBUTION, AND EXPLORE ENERGY INFRASTRUCTURE OPTIONS FOR THE NEW RENO GOVERNMENT COMPLEX.RSIC IS MOTIVATED TO IMPLEMENT THE BUSINESS AND REGULATORY FRAMEWORK PROPOSED IN THIS APPLICATION FOR MANY REASONS. THE HUNGRY VALLEY RSIC COMMUNITY IS AN ENERGY ISLAND WITH UNIQUE ENERGY NEEDS, AND THE RENO COMMUNITY IS EXPANDING ITS INFRASTRUCTURE AND WANTS TO DO SO IN AN ENERGY CONSCIOUS MANNER. ADDITIONALLY, IN APRIL 2019 THE NEVADA LEGISLATURE PASSED A BILL THAT REQUIRES 50  OF ELECTRICITY IN THE STATE TO BE GENERATED FROM RENEWABLE SOURCES BY 2030, AND 100  OF ITS POWER FROM CARBON FREE SOURCES BY 2050. THUS, THE TRIBE WANTS TO GAIN GOVERNANCE SURROUNDING ENERGY AND UTILITIES TO ADVOCATE FOR THE DIVERSE AND UNIQUE NEEDS OF THE TRIBE AND ITS MEMBERS IN BOTH THE RURAL HUNGRY VALLEY AND URBAN RENO COMMUNITIES.THIS PROJECT AIMS TO MAKE RSIC MORE ENERGY INDEPENDENT, WHILE IMPROVING THE COST AND RELIABILITY OF ENERGY IN THE COMMUNITY AS WELL AS EXPLORING RENEWABLE ENERGY OPTIONS. RSIC WANTS TO IMPROVE ENERGY CAPACITY FOR BOTH ITS RURAL HUNGRY VALLEY AND URBAN RENO COMMUNITIES SO IT CAN PROVIDE MORE RELIABLE UTILITY SERVICES AT MORE AFFORDABLE COSTS TO ITS TRIBAL MEMBERS, WHILE ALSO GAINING ENERGY INDEPENDENCE AND ASSERTING TRIBAL SOVEREIGNTY. TO MEET THIS GOAL, THIS PROJECT WILL DELIVER (1) A CLEAR PICTURE OF RSICS CURRENT ENERGY, LEGAL REGULATORY, ORGANIZATIONAL, AND FINANCIAL CAPACITY, INCLUDING MAPS OF TRIBAL UTILITIES (WHERE APPLICABLE)  (2) A DRAFT TRANSACTIONAL CODE ORDINANCE FOR ADOPTION BY THE RSIC TRIBAL COUNCIL  (3) A VISION FOR THE RSIC TRIBAL UTILITY AUTHORITY AND ENERGY INFRASTRUCTURE FOR THE NEW RENO GOVERNMENT COMPLEX  (4) IF DEEMED FEASIBLE, A NEWLY CHARTED TRIBAL ENTITY IN THE FORM OF A TRIBAL UTILITY AUTHORITY WITH THE POWERS TO ENGAGE WITH SURROUNDING UTILITIES, FEDERAL AND STATE AGENCIES, AND THE RSIC COMMUNITY  (5) A ROADMAP AND BUSINESS PLAN FOR ADDRESSING CAPACITY GAPS, INCLUDING POLICIES, REGULATIONS, AND CODES  AND (6) A FINAL REPORT AND PRESENTATION (IN POWERPOINT FORMAT) SUMMARIZING THE FINDINGS OF THE FEASIBILITY STUDY CONDUCTED UNDER THIS PROPOSED PROJECT AS WELL AS THE ROADMAP AND BUSINESS PLAN.

THE PECHANGA BAND OF INDIANS, LOCATED IN TEMECULA CALIFORNIA, (THE BAND) BEGAN THE OPERATION OF THE FIRST WHOLESALE TRIBAL ELECTRIC UTILITY IN CALIFORNIA IN 2017. THE UTILITY, KNOWN AS PECHANGA WESTERN ELECTRIC (PWE), SERVES THE ELECTRIC NEEDS OF THE BANDS RESORT AND COMMERCIAL OPERATIONS, THE GOVERNMENT CENTER, AND SOME OF THE RESERVATION RESIDENTS. PWE WISHES TO COMMISSION FOUR STUDIES TO DETERMINE 1) THE REGULATORY STEPS NECESSARY TO PURCHASE AND HAVE DELIVERED WHOLESALE NATURAL GAS AND DIESEL FUEL IN CALIFORNIA, 2) THE TECHNICAL FEASIBILITY, SUCH AS METERING, PIPELINES, STORAGE AND OTHER FACILITIES OR EQUIPMENT NEEDED FOR THIS EFFORT AND THEIR COSTS  3) THE FINANCIAL FEASIBILITY OF THESE EFFORTS IN COMPARISON TO THE EXISTING RETAIL PURCHASE OF NATURAL GAS AND DIESEL  AND 4) THE POTENTIAL FOR PURCHASING NATURAL GAS FROM ANOTHER INDIAN TRIBE THAT PRODUCES GAS. THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROJECT ARE A) ADVANCE TRIBAL SOVEREIGNTY, ENERGY INDEPENDENCE AND  ENERGY SELF SUFFICIENCY  B) TO LOWER COSTS OF BOTH NATURAL GAS AND ELECTRICITY TO THE BAND AND ITS MEMBERS  C) TO IMPROVE ELECTRIC RELIABILITY BY DECREASING THE NEED FOR DELIVERY OF ELECTRICITY THROUGH THE REGIONAL POWER GRID BY GENERATING MORE ELECTRICITY FROM NATURAL GAS ON THE RESERVATION  D) TO ENCOURAGE COMMERCE BETWEEN TRIBES BY DETERMINING WHETHER PWE CAN FEASIBLY PURCHASE AND HAVE DELIVERED NATURAL GAS FROM ANOTHER INDIAN TRIBE WHO PRODUCES GAS  WHILE DECREASING OR ELIMINATING THE VARIOUS TAXES ON DELIVERED NATURAL GAS BY BUYING THE COMMODITIES FROM ANOTHER TRIBAL SOVEREIGN.

SENECA NATION OF INDIANS SENECA ENERGY ORGANIZATIONAL DEVELOPMENT PROJECT WILL REBUILD THE NATIONS CAPACITY FOR ENERGY RESOURCE REGULATION AND GOVERNANCE. IN 2012, SENECA NATION OF INDIANS (SNI) ESTABLISHED SENECA ENERGY TO ENSURE THE SECURITY, PROSPERITY AND INDEPENDENCE OF THE SENECA NATION BY BUILDING A SUSTAINABLE ENERGY PLATFORM AND LOWERING ENERGY COSTS OF THE NATION AND ITS RESIDENTS (SENECA ENERGY MISSION). SENECA ENERGY IS CURRENTLY UNDERGOING A CRITICAL PERIOD OF GROWTH. DUE TO COVID 19 RELATED DOWNSIZING, SNI HAD TO DISBAND SENECA ENERGYS UTILITIES COMMISSION AND IS NOW JUST ABLE TO RECONVENE IT. AS A RESULT, SNI SEEKS TO ASSESS AND DEVELOP SENECA ENERGYS TECHNICAL, ADMINISTRATIVE, ORGANIZATIONAL, AND MANAGEMENT CAPACITY DURING THIS PERIOD OF ORGANIZATIONAL GROWTH. THE NATION IS CURRENTLY WORKING ON EXPANDING ITS NATURAL GAS AND FIBER BROADBAND DISTRIBUTION SYSTEMS. THIS PROJECTED GROWTH REQUIRES FURTHER DEVELOPMENT OF THE SENECA ENERGY UTILITIES COMMISSION AND MANAGEMENT TEAM.THIS PROJECTS GOAL IS TO RE BUILD NATION CAPACITY FOR ENERGY RESOURCE REGULATION AND GOVERNMENTS, WHICH WILL SUPPORT SNIS LONG TERM GOAL OF ACHIEVING COMPLETE, EFFECTIVE ENERGY INDEPENDENCE. TO ACHIEVE THIS PROJECT GOAL, SNIS OBJECTIVES ARE TO  (1) REINTRODUCE A POLICY GOVERNANCE STRUCTURE AND FORMALIZE IT WITH THE UTILITIES COMMISSION  (2) ASSESS AND DEVELOP IMPROVEMENTS FOR CONSOLIDATION OF ELECTRIC POWER, NATURAL GAS, AND BROADBAND INFRASTRUCTURE MANAGEMENT AND COST RECOVERY FOR SUSTAINABLE OPERATIONS  AND (3) DETERMINE WHAT PROCESSES AND PROCEDURES WILL ELIMINATE CAPACITY GAPS AND HAVE A PLAN FOR HOW TO IMPLEMENT THOSE PROCESSES AND PROCEDURES. THIS PROJECT WILL DELIVER THE FOLLOWING  (1) A UTILITIES COMMISSION THAT CAN COMPREHEND AND IMPLEMENT POLICY GOVERNANCE PRINCIPLES, SO THEY BECOME PART OF THE INSTITUTIONAL MEMORY OF THE UTILITY  (2) UPDATED UTILITY POLICY, REGULATIONS, CODES, AND BILLING RATE STRUCTURES  AND (3) A FINAL PRESENTATION AND REPORT SUMMARIZING THE EFFORTS PERFORMED UNDER THIS GRANT PROJECT AS WELL AS A ROADMAP FOR IMPLEMENTING RECOMMENDATIONS.

THE OTOE MISSOURIA TRIBE OF INDIANS IN RED ROCK, OKLAHOMA SEEKS TEDC FUNDING TO CONDUCT A STUDY INTO THE FEASIBILITY OF DEVELOPING A TRIBAL UTILITY AUTHORITY (TUA), WHICH IS A CHARTERED TRIBAL ENTITY CAPABLE OF GOVERNING, DISTRIBUTING, AND MANAGING TRIBAL ENERGY AND UTILITIES. THE TRIBE IS MOTIVATED TO ESTABLISH ITS OWN TUA TO REDUCE ENERGY COSTS FOR ITS 3,000 TRIBAL MEMBERS, ALIGN THE TRIBES ENERGY USE AND PRODUCTION WITH TRIBAL VALUES BY EXPLORING SUSTAINABLE ENERGY SOURCES, AND IMPROVE ENERGY RESILIENCE AND RELIABILITY. THE TRIBE BELIEVES A TUA WOULD ALLOW THE TRIBE TO TAKE MORE CONTROL OF THEIR RESOURCES, IMPROVE THE TRIBES ECONOMIC SITUATION, AND INCREASE TRIBAL SOVEREIGNTY, WHILE ALSO BEST SERVING OUR TRIBAL MEMBERS WITH RELIABLE AND COST EFFECTIVE ENERGY.THE TRIBE HAS ALREADY GAINED GOVERNANCE OVER PROPANE AND WATER DISTRIBUTION AND HAVE TRIBAL ENTITIES TO SUPPORT THE DISTRIBUTION AND BILLING OF THESE RESOURCES TO THE OTOE MISSOURIA COMMUNITY AND EVEN THE LARGER TOWN OF RED ROCK (IN THE CASE OF WATER). THIS PROJECT REPRESENTS ANOTHER STEP IN OUR TRIBES JOURNEY TOWARD SELF SUFFICIENCY AND CONTRIBUTES TO ALL THREE INGREDIENTS OF ECONOMIC GROWTH. ESTABLISHING A TUA WILL INCREASE OUR TRIBAL SOVEREIGNTY, EMPOWER OUR TRIBAL INSTITUTIONS TO MAKE DECISIONS AND ADMINISTER POLICY, AND ALIGN THE TRIBES INSTITUTIONS (IN THIS CASE, A TUA) WITH OUR VALUES BY EXPLORING MORE SUSTAINABLE ENERGY RESOURCES.TEDC GRANT FUNDS WILL SUPPORT THE TRIBE IN (1) ASSESSING THE CURRENT STATE OF ENERGY INFRASTRUCTURE AND UTILITY SERVICES  (2) ASSESSING ENERGY REQUIREMENTS AND IDENTIFYING TECHNOLOGIES WITH PREFERENCE ON RENEWABLE ENERGY RESOURCES, SUCH AS SOLAR AND WIND  (3) ASSESSING POWER NEEDS FOR BACKUP POWER FOR THE ELDER HOUSING DEVELOPMENT (I.E., ASSESS THE FEASIBILITY OF THE FIRST UTILITY DISTRICT)  (4) DRAFTING ORDINANCES AND A FRAMEWORK FOR ORDINANCES  AND (5) PROVIDING A FINAL RECOMMENDATION REPORT AND ROADMAP FOR MOVING FORWARD. THE OTOE MISSOURIA TRIBE EXPECTS THIS PROJECT TO REINFORCE OUR TRIBES COMMITMENT TO RESPONSIBLY MANAGING TRIBAL LANDS TO PROMOTE ENVIRONMENT SUSTAINABILITY, CREATE JOBS AND WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR OUR COMMUNITY, AND INCREASE ENERGY RESILIENCE WHILE LOWERING ENERGY COSTS FOR THE TRIBE AND ITS TRIBAL MEMBERS. THE FINAL DELIVERABLES WILL INCLUDE A FORMAL ROADMAP AND BUSINESS PLAN ALONG WITH THE FINALIZATION OF UNIFORM COMMERCIAL CODES.

THROUGH THE TRIBAL ELECTRIC UTILITY DISTRICT FEASIBILITY STUDY PROJECT, WE, THE LUMMI NATION WILL ASSESS THE FEASIBILITY OF ESTABLISHING A TRIBAL ELECTRIC UTILITY DISTRICT (TEUD) TO CONSOLIDATE AND DIRECT THE RENEWABLE ENERGY PROJECTS TOWARDS GOAL OF ENERGY SOVEREIGNTY FOR THE LUMMI PEOPLE. THE STUDY WILL RESULT IN AN ACTIONABLE PLAN FOR THE LUMMI INDIAN BUSINESS COUNCIL AND ADMINISTRATION TO ESTABLISH THE APPROPRIATE STRUCTURE, DRAFT POLICIES, ENABLE INFORMED AND DATA DRIVEN DECISION MAKING REGARDING VIABLE LARGE SCALE ENERGY PROJECTS, AND CONSOLIDATE NEGOTIATIONS WITH EXTERNAL VENDORS AND PARTNERS.THE TRIBAL ELECTRIC UTILITY DISTRICT IS A DESIGNATION THAT ALLOWS THE TRIBE TO CONSOLIDATE THE ENERGY GENERATION EFFORTS OF THE TRIBE AND NEGOTIATE FAVORABLE CONTROL OF ENERGY GENERATION SYSTEMS AND RATES FOR ENERGY DISTRIBUTED TO COMMUNITY MEMBERS WITHIN THE DISTRICT SERVICE AREA. WITH A TEUD THE TRIBE WOULD HAVE CONTROL FOR ENERGY DISTRIBUTION.THE NATION ALREADY OPERATES A TRIBAL WATER AND SEWAGE UTILITY DISTRICT THAT SERVES 5,748 PEOPLE, 2,300 HOMES, AND 23 ANCHOR INSTITUTIONS ON THE LUMMI RESERVATION IN NORTHERN WASHINGTON. THE NATION WANTS TO UTILIZE THE FRAMEWORK THEY HAVE WITH THE WATER AND SEWAGE DISTRICT, LEVERAGING SOME OF THOSE ADMINISTRATIVE FUNCTIONS TO CREATE AN ENERGY TEUD. THE EXPANDED TEUD WILL MANAGE AND DISTRIBUTE ENERGY, BROADBAND PHONE, WATER AND SEWER, AND SOLID WASTE. THE LUMMI NATION IDENTIFIED SEVERAL REASONS FOR UNDERTAKING STRATEGIC ENERGY PLANNING, PRIMARILY INCLUDING  (1) TO IMPROVE ECONOMIC AND ENERGY SELF SUFFICIENCY OF THE TRIBE AND (2) TO REDUCE EMISSIONS FROM ENERGY USE ON THE RESERVATION.

THE LAC COURTE OREILLES BAND OF LAKE SUPERIOR CHIPPEWA (LCO) IS A FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED TRIBE LOCATED WITHIN MIXED FOREST WOODS, WATER, AND WETLANDS WITHIN SAWYER COUNTY, WISCONSIN. THE RESERVATION IS ADJACENT TO THE CHEQUAMEGON NATIONAL FOREST AND IS APPROXIMATELY 15 SQUARE MILES, 76,000 ACRES, WITH 2,000 MEMBERS RESIDING WITHIN 25 SEPARATE COMMUNITIES. THE LCO PEOPLE CONTINUE TO PRACTICE TRADITIONAL SUBSISTENCE BY HUNTING, FISHING, AND GATHERING THROUGHOUT THE FOUR SEASONS. IN ADDITION, LCO PEOPLE ENJOY YEAR ROUND RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES.THE TRIBE IS SERVED BY THREE ELECTRICAL UTILITIES TRAVERSING VARIOUS REGIONS OF RESERVATION LANDS  1) JUMP RIVER ELECTRICAL COOPERATIVE, 2) NORTH CENTRAL POWER CO, AND 3) XCEL ENERGY. THESE NON TRIBAL UTILITIES CONTROL THE ENERGY DECISIONS AND INVESTMENTS IN POWER SUPPLY, POWER DELIVERY, AND CUSTOMER SERVICE THAT AFFECT LCOS BUSINESSES AND TRIBAL MEMBERS. LCOS TRIBAL LEADERSHIP BELIEVES THAT THE TRIBES ECONOMIC PROSPERITY DIRECTLY RELIES ON CLEAN, AFFORDABLE, AND RELIABLE ENERGY AND THE ASSOCIATED INFRASTRUCTURE TO DELIVER THAT ENERGY. IN ADDITION, LCO SEEKS OPPORTUNITIES TO FORM ENTERPRISES THAT PROVIDE EMPLOYMENT FOR TRIBAL MEMBERS IS A RELATED PRIORITY FOR THE TRIBE. CURRENTLY, LCO IS AN ELECTRIC CUSTOMER AND HAS NO CONTROL OVER THE ELECTRIC UTILITY LANDSCAPE ON RESERVATION. LCO DOESNT CONTROL WHERE POWER COMES FROM, HOW ITS DELIVERED TO CUSTOMERS, WHO IS EMPLOYED TO MAINTAIN THE ELECTRIC SYSTEM ON THE RESERVATION, HOW ELECTRIC RATES AND POLICIES ARE SET, AND HOW CUSTOMER SERVICE IS PERFORMED FOR TRIBAL BUSINESSES AND MEMBERS WHO ARE ELECTRIC CUSTOMERS. THE TRIBES VISION IS TO REDEFINE THE ENERGY PLANNING AND MANAGEMENT PARADIGM ON RESERVATION. THE LCO TRIBAL UTILITY FEASIBILITY STUDY IS THE TRIBES FIRST MAJOR STEP TO EVALUATE WHETHER A TRIBALLY OWNED ELECTRIC UTILITY BETTER ALIGNS WITH LCOS ENERGY VISION THAN THE CURRENT APPROACH AS AN ELECTRIC CUSTOMER TO 3 UTILITIES. THE STUDY ESTABLISHES AN ELECTRIC BASELINE FOR TRIBAL UTILITY COMPARISON, EVALUATES VARIOUS TRIBAL UTILITY AUTHORITY FORMATION STRATEGIES WITHIN ONE OR MORE OF THE 3 INCUMBENT UTILITY TERRITORIES, AND ULTIMATELY RESULTS IN A DRAFT CHARTER AND BYLAWS FOR THE RECOMMENDED TRIBAL UTILITY STRATEGY.

DESCRIPTION OF THE PROJECT AND OBJECTIVESTHE PUEBLO HAS ALREADY CONSTRUCTED A 1.2MW COMMERCIAL SOLAR PROJECT AND IS IN THE PROCESS OF DEVELOPING AN ADDITIONAL 1 MW OF SOLAR AND CONSIDERABLE BATTERY STORAGE. TO BEST UTILIZE THE NEW RESOURCES IN SUPPORT OF A TRIBAL UTILITY, PICURIS PUEBLO PROPOSES FOUR PROJECTS UNDER THE TEDC GRANT.  FIRST, THE PUEBLO WISHES TO DETERMINE THE OPTIMAL ENTITY FORM FOR A TRIBAL UTILITY THAT WILL PROVIDE WATER, COMMUNICATION AND APPROPRIATE ELECTRIC SERVICES TO THE PUEBLO, THEN FORM THE ENTITY AND ESTABLISH ITS GOVERNANCE.  SECOND, THE PUEBLO WISHES TO DRAFT APPROPRIATE UTILITY CODE PROVISIONS THAT WILL SUPPORT THE UTILITY AND PARTICULARLY ITS ENERGY SERVICES, FOR CONSIDERATION BY THE TRIBAL COUNCIL. THIRD, THE PUEBLO WISHES TO COMMISSION A STUDY TO IDENTIFY THE SPECIFIC TECHNICAL AND FINANCIAL DETAILS OF A TRIBAL ELECTRIC UTILITY TO BE DESCRIBED IN A DETAILED REPORT. FOURTH, AS WE ANTICIPATE THAT THE UTILITY WILL REQUIRE VARIOUS AGREEMENTS, SUCH AS RIGHTS OF WAYS OR SOLAR INTERCONNECTIONS, WE WISH TO SUPPORT THE COMPLETION OF THOSE AGREEMENTS. THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROJECT ARE A) ADVANCING TRIBAL SOVEREIGNTY, B) PROMOTING ENERGY INDEPENDENCE AND ENERGY SELF SUFFICIENCY  AND C) ASSURING REASONABLE ELECTRIC COSTS THROUGH OPERATION OF A PUEBLO UTILITY THAT DELIVERS TRIBALLY GENERATED RENEWABLE SOLAR POWER TO THE PUEBLO CUSTOMERS.STATEMENT OF METHODS TO BE EMPLOYEDPICURIS PUEBLO WILL UTILIZE THE SERVICES OF MARGARET SCHAFF AND EVAN DEWITT OF NATIVE ENERGY RESOURCE COUNSEL, LLC, A LAW FIRM CURRENTLY UNDER CONTRACT AND KEN SALINE AND KENT SIMER OF K. R. SALINE AND ASSOCIATES, PLC, TO PROVIDE ENGINEERING SERVICES.  IN ORDER TO ACHIEVE THE OBJECTIVES, THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES WILL OCCUR 1.TO FORM THE ENTITY, THE ENTITY OPTIONS AND THEIR GOVERNANCE PROCESSES WILL BE PRESENTED TO THE TRIBAL COUNCIL WHO WILL DETERMINE THE OPTIMAL ENTITY FORM, GIVEN THE SITUATION ON THE GROUND. THEN, DOCUMENTS WILL BE DRAFTED TO FORM THE ENTITY AND THEY WILL BE CONSIDERED AND APPROVED BY THE TRIBAL COUNCIL. GOVERNANCE WILL BE ESTABLISHED PURSUANT TO THE DOCUMENTS.2.TO APPROVE A UTILITY CODE, OPTIONS FOR CODE PROVISIONS WILL BE PRESENTED IN WRITING TO THE TRIBAL COUNCIL, LIKELY AT THE SAME TIME AS THE ENTITY FORMATION OPTIONS ARE PRESENTED. THE TRIBAL COUNCIL WILL CONSIDER THE OPTIONS AND DETERMINE WHICH TYPES OF CODE PROVISIONS ARE NEEDED.  A DRAFT WILL BE PROVIDED, AND AFTER APPROPRIATE CHANGES, AND ANY NEEDED COMMUNITY AND UTILITY MEETINGS, THE CODE WILL BE CONSIDERED FOR PASSAGE BY THE TRIBAL COUNCIL, AND APPROVAL BY THE SECRETARY OF THE INTERIOR, IF NEEDED.3.THE FEASIBILITY STUDY OF THE TECHNICAL AND FINANCIAL DETAILS OF A TRIBAL ELECTRIC UTILITY WILL INCORPORATE THE CONSIDERABLE INFORMATION ALREADY GENERATED BY THE PUEBLOS SOLAR AND BATTERY STUDIES INTO A FINANCIAL REPORT DETAILING ALL THE STEPS NEEDED FOR INCORPORATING THE TRIBES INFRASTRUCTURE INTO A TRIBAL UTILITY OPERATION. THE FINANCIAL FEASIBILITY WILL INCLUDE A COMPARISON OF UTILITY RATES WITH POTENTIAL TRIBAL UTILITY RATES AFTER RESEARCH OF ALL PROJECT COSTS.4.THE GRANT WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT ANY STEPS REQUIRING AGREEMENTS WITH THE EXISTING UTILITY, SUCH AS RIGHTS OF WAYS, MAINTENANCE AGREEMENTS OR INTERCONNECTION AGREEMENTS. SUPPORT WILL INCLUDE MEETINGS, REVIEW OF AGREEMENTS, AND SIMILAR EXPERT CONSULTING SUPPORT.

THE WHITE EARTH BAND OF CHIPPEWA (A.K.A. WHITE EARTH NATION) IN WHITE EARTH, MINNESOTA SEEKS TEDC FUNDING TO CONDUCT A STUDY INTO THE FEASIBILITY OF DEVELOPING A TRIBAL UTILITY AUTHORITY (TUA), WHICH IS A CHARTERED TRIBAL ENTITY CAPABLE OF GOVERNING, DISTRIBUTING, AND MANAGING TRIBAL ENERGY AND UTILITIES. THE TRIBE IS MOTIVATED TO ESTABLISH ITS OWN TUA TO REDUCE ENERGY COSTS FOR ITS 5,345 ON RESERVATION TRIBAL MEMBERS, ALIGN THE TRIBES ENERGY USE AND PRODUCTION WITH TRIBAL VALUES BY EXPLORING SUSTAINABLE ENERGY SOURCES, AND IMPROVE ENERGY RESILIENCE AND RELIABILITY. THE TRIBE BELIEVES A TUA WOULD ALLOW THE TRIBE TO TAKE MORE CONTROL OF THEIR RESOURCES, IMPROVE THE TRIBES ECONOMIC SITUATION, AND INCREASE TRIBAL SOVEREIGNTY, WHILE ALSO BEST SERVING OUR TRIBAL MEMBERS WITH RELIABLE AND COST EFFECTIVE ENERGY.THE TRIBE HAS TAKEN THE FIRST STEP TO ESTABLISH A TUA WITH THE CREATION OF A TRIBAL UTILITIES COMMISSION. THE COMMISSION ESTABLISHES THE GOVERNANCE OVER UTILITIES DEVELOPING ON THE RESERVATION. THE TRIBES PUBLIC WORKS DEPARTMENT HAS THE EXPERIENCE WITH MANAGING, OPERATING, AND MAINTAINING WATER AND WASTEWATER SYSTEMS. THE DEPARTMENT ALSO HAS CONSTRUCTION CREWS THAT MAINTAIN AND CONSTRUCT ROADS AND THE WATER AND WASTEWATER SYSTEMS, SERVICES THAT A UTILITY WILL NEED. THIS PROJECT REPRESENTS ANOTHER STEP IN OUR TRIBES JOURNEY TOWARD SELF SUFFICIENCY AND CONTRIBUTES TO ALL THREE INGREDIENTS OF ECONOMIC GROWTH. ESTABLISHING A TUA WILL INCREASE OUR TRIBAL SOVEREIGNTY, EMPOWER OUR TRIBAL INSTITUTIONS TO MAKE DECISIONS AND ADMINISTER POLICY, AND ALIGN THE TRIBES INSTITUTIONS (IN THIS CASE, A TUA) WITH OUR VALUES BY EXPLORING MORE SUSTAINABLE ENERGY RESOURCES.TEDC GRANT FUNDS WILL SUPPORT THE TRIBE IN (1) ASSESSING THE CURRENT STATE OF ENERGY INFRASTRUCTURE AND UTILITY SERVICES  (2) ASSESSING ENERGY REQUIREMENTS AND IDENTIFYING TECHNOLOGIES WITH PREFERENCE ON RENEWABLE ENERGY RESOURCES, SUCH AS SOLAR AND WIND  (3) ASSESSING POWER NEEDS FOR TWO AREAS ON THE RESERVATION (I.E., ASSESS THE FEASIBILITY OF THE FIRST UTILITY DISTRICTS)  (4) DRAFTING A CHARTER FOR THE TUA  AND (5) PROVIDING A FINAL RECOMMENDATION REPORT AND ROADMAP FOR MOVING FORWARD. THE WHITE EARTH BAND OF CHIPPEWA EXPECTS THIS PROJECT TO REINFORCE OUR TRIBES COMMITMENT TO RESPONSIBLY MANAGING TRIBAL LANDS TO PROMOTE ENVIRONMENT SUSTAINABILITY, CREATE JOBS AND WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR OUR COMMUNITY, AND INCREASE ENERGY RESILIENCE WHILE LOWERING ENERGY COSTS FOR THE TRIBE AND ITS TRIBAL MEMBERS. THE FINAL DELIVERABLES WILL INCLUDE A FORMAL ROADMAP AND BUSINESS PLAN ALONG WITH THE FINALIZATION OF UNIFORM COMMERCIAL CODES.

SPIRIT LAKE TRIBE (SLT) IS SEEKING FUNDING TO COMPLETE A TEDC PHASE II STUDY TO CHARTER A TRIBAL UTILITY AUTHORITY (TUA) ENTITY UPON IT S RESERVATION WITH THE ULTIMATE GOAL OF WORKING WITH AN ENERGY WHOLESALER, TO NEGOTIATE A POWER PURCHASE AGREEMENT (PPA) TO SELL POWER TO A DATA MINING COMPANY WHICH IS INTERESTED IN BUILDING A FACILITY ON THE RESERVATION AND IN PURCHASING ELECTRICITY FROM SLT. THE GOAL OF THE GRANT IS TO 1). FORM A TUA, 2). SUCCESSFULLY NEGOTIATE A PPA, AND 3). HIRE NECESSARY STAFF TO MANAGE THE TUA.

THE PASKENTA BAND OF NOMLAKI INDIANS (THE TRIBE) IS A FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED INDIAN TRIBE LOCATED IN CORNING, CA. THE TRIBE VALUES SOVEREIGNTY, SELF DETERMINATION, AND CONTROL OF ITS TRIBAL LANDS. THE TRIBE OWNS AND OPERATES THE ROLLING HILLS CASINO AND  RESORT (THE CASINO), THE ROLLING HILLS HEALTH CLINIC, GOLF COURSE, EQUESTRIAN CENTER, AND A TRIBAL ADMINISTRATION BUILDING COMMUNITY CENTER  ALL LOCATED ON TRUST LAND IN CORNING, NORTHERN CALIFORNIA. THE TRIBE AIMS TO FIND NEW ENERGY GENERATION AND UTILIZATION OPTIONS UPON ITS LAND AND TO EXPLORE OTHER SUSTAINABLE TECHNOLOGIES AND POLICIES, WHICH WILL IMPROVE SOVEREIGNTY AND RESILIENCE OF ITS FACILITIES, ENHANCE ECONOMIC DIVERSIFICATION, AND REDUCE GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS ASSOCIATED WITH THE TRIBES COMMERCIAL, CULTURAL AND COMMUNITY ACTIVITIES.ALTHOUGH THE TRIBE CURRENTLY RELIES ON PGAND E TO POWER ITS INSTITUTIONS AND BUSINESSES, THE TRIBE IS IN THE PROCESS OF DEVELOPING A MICROGRID WITH 2 MW OF SOLAR AND 3 TO 8 MW OF ENERGY STORAGE AND PLANS DEVELOP A TRIBAL UTILITY. THE TRIBES SMALL LOAD HAS CREATED CHALLENGES TO FIND COUNTERPARTIES WILLING TO PROVIDE WHOLESALE POWER AND WHOLESALE MARKET PARTICIPATION SERVICES ONCE THE TRIBAL UTILITY IS IN PLACE. THE TRIBE IS SEEKING GRANT FUNDING TO EXPLORE HOW IT CAN EXPAND THE PLANNED TRIBAL UTILITY AND MICROGRID BY ATTRACTING LOAD TO THE PASKENTA RANCHERIA. THE FUNDING WILL ALSO AID THE TRIBE IN EXPLORING HOW TRIBES IN CALIFORNIA CAN WORK TOGETHER TO DEVELOP AN INTERTRIBAL ORGANIZATION BASED AROUND ENERGY SYSTEMS.IF SUCCESSFUL THE FORMATION OF A TRIBAL UTILITY WITH COMPETITIVE WHOLESALE MARKET PRICES IS ACHIEVED, THIS COULD SERVE AS A DEMONSTRATION PROJECT FOR OTHER TRIBES TO ATTRACT ENERGY INTENSIVE BUSINESS TO THEIR TRIBAL LANDS.IF MULTIPLE TRIBES ARE WILLING TO ENGAGE WITH EACH OTHER, THIS COULD LEAD TO THE FORMATION OF AN INTERTRIBAL POWER AGENCY OR ANOTHER ORGANIZATIONAL STRUCTURE WHICH ALLOWS TRIBES TO ENGAGE COLLABORATIVELY.

THE MORONGO BAND OF MISSION INDIANS (MBMI OR THE TRIBE) IS SEEKING FUNDING TO EXPLORE THE FEASIBILITY OF A SPECIAL UTILITY DISTRICT (SUD) THAT WOULD ALLOW THE TRIBE TO ACT AS A DISTRIBUTION UTILITY FOR FUTURE DEVELOPMENT PROJECTS ON TRIBAL TRUST LAND.MBMI PLACES SIGNIFICANT VALUE ON ITS SELF GOVERNANCE. GIVEN THE CURRENT MARKET UNCERTAINTIES, MBMI DESIRES MORE AUTONOMY TO CREATE RESILIENT INFRASTRUCTURE THAT BENEFITS ITS MEMBERS. A NUMBER OF INITIATIVES DESIGNED TO REDUCE ELECTRIC COST ACROSS ITS RESERVATION ARE UNDERWAY AND THIS INITIATIVE SUPPORTS THOSE EFFORTS.THIS PROJECT WILL COMPLETE THE FOLLOWING  (1) DRAFT A LEGAL AND ORGANIZATIONAL FRAMEWORK THAT ESTABLISHES A TUA WITH THE ABILITY TO ADMINISTER A SPECIAL UTILITY DISTRICT WITH A COST COMPETITIVE RATE STRUCTURE FOR ITS RATE PAYERS  (2) OUTLINE A PLAN TO OPTIMIZE THE INCORPORATION OF FUTURE DEVELOPMENT PROJECTS INTO THE SPECIAL UTILITY DISTRICT  (3) FINALIZE A COST ESTIMATE THAT DETAILS WHAT ADDITIONAL INFRASTRUCTURE THE TRIBE NEEDS TO CONSTRUCT TO OPERATE THE SUD  AND (4) SUBMIT A TECHNICAL 35  DESIGN FOR THE INFRASTRUCTURE REQUIRED TO CONNECT TO THE ELECTRIC GRID.THIS PROJECT WILL DELIVER A FINAL REPORT THAT WILL ACT AS THE ACTION PLAN THAT MBMI CAN USE TO TAKE THE NEXT STEPS IN FORMING A TUA AND SUD AND A FINAL PRESENTATION TO THE TRIBAL COUNCIL AND ALL TRIBAL STAKEHOLDERS.

THIS PROJECT WILL BUILD CAPACITY FOR BEAR RIVER BAND OF THE ROHNERVILLE RANCHERIA TRIBAL ADMINISTRATION FOR RENEWABLE ENERGY REGULATION, PLANNING, AND IMPLEMENTATION THROUGH THE DEVELOPMENT OF ORGANIZATIONAL STRUCTURE, NAMELY AN ENERGY REGULATORY COMMISSION.

THE FORT INDEPENDENCE INDIAN COMMUNITY (TRIBE) IS SUBMITTING A TRIBAL ENERGY DEVELOPMENT CAPACITY (TEDC) GRANT PROPOSAL FOR THE PROPOSED PROJECT, ENERGY SOVEREIGNTY  DEVELOPMENT OF FORT INDEPENDENCE COMMUNITYS TRIBAL UTILITY AUTHORITY FEASIBILITY STUDY. THE FORT INDEPENDENCE INDIAN RESERVATION (RESERVATION) FACES STRUCTURAL INEQUITIES BECAUSE THE INCUMBENT UTILITY, LOS ANGELES DEPARTMENT OF WATER AND POWER (LADWP), HAS PREVENTED DEVELOPMENT IN THE OWENS VALLEY, WHERE FORT INDEPENDENCE IS LOCATED. AS A RESULT, THE TRIBE AND ITS RESIDENTS HAVE HIGH ENERGY COSTS, AND EXPERIENCE UNRELIABLE POWER WITH FREQUENT BROWN AND BLACK OUTS. THE TRIBE WANTS TO DEVELOP A TRIBAL UTILITY AUTHORITY (TUA), WHICH IS A TRIBALLY OWNED AND MANAGED ENTITY CAPABLE OF NEGOTIATING WITH PUBLIC UTILITY COMPANIES AND ASSUMING CONTROL, DISTRIBUTION, AND DEVELOPMENT OF UTILITIES THAT SERVE THE TRIBAL RESERVATION. THE TRIBE IS MOTIVATED TO ESTABLISH A TUA BECAUSE IT WILL ASSIST THE TRIBE IN OVERCOMING OVER A CENTURY OF INEQUITABLE ACCESS TO AFFORDABLE ENERGY SOURCES. A TUA, IF DEEMED FEASIBLE THROUGH THE PROPOSED STUDY, WILL STRENGTHEN TRIBAL SOVEREIGNTY AND SELF DETERMINATION BY INCREASING TRIBAL MANAGEMENT AND CAPACITY. IT WILL ALLOW THE TRIBE TO NEGOTIATE ITS OWN RATES AND DEVELOP ITS OWN ENERGY RESOURCES SO THAT IT CAN LOWER ENERGY COSTS AND IMPROVE ENERGY RELIABILITY FOR ITS RESIDENTS.THIS STUDY WILL DELIVER A COMPREHENSIVE UNDERSTANDING OF CURRENT ENERGY USE AND COSTS, PROVIDE THE TRIBE INSIGHT INTO EXISTING AND FUTURE EFFICIENCY AND CONSERVATION STRATEGIES, AND REVEAL VALUABLE OPPORTUNITIES TO FURTHER REDUCE ENERGY COSTS THROUGH NEW COMMUNITY AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMS AND ACTIVITIES BOTH SHORT AND LONG TERM. THE TRIBAL COMMUNITY WILL DEFINE THE UNIQUE ENERGY GOALS AND PRIORITIES THROUGH STAKEHOLDER INPUT, DIALOG, AND CONSENSUS BUILDING. THIS PLAN WILL INTEGRATE ENERGY, ENVIRONMENTAL, ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT, BROADBAND, AND COMMUNITY VALUES IN A COMPREHENSIVE MANNER.THE TRIBE WILL PARTNER WITH A PRIVATE CONSULTING FIRM (CONTRACTOR) TO DEVELOP A TRIBAL UTILITY AUTHORITY FEASIBILITY STUDY, WHICH WILL ASSESS THE TRIBES CURRENT ENERGY RESOURCES, EXISTING BARRIERS, CAPACITY, AND OPPORTUNITIES FOR ECONOMIC DIVERSIFICATION. THE TRIBAL CHAIRMAN WILL OVERSEE THIS 12 MONTH PROJECT. THE KEY OUTCOME OF THIS GRANT IS A COMPREHENSIVE TRIBAL UTILITY AUTHORITY FEASIBILITY STUDY AND ROADMAP, DEVELOPED BY KEY TRIBAL STAKEHOLDERS, INCLUDING THE LADWP. THE STUDY WILL BE INCORPORATED INTO THE TRIBES MASTER COMMUNITY AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT PLAN. TOTAL PROJECT COSTS ARE  175,000. PROJECT FUNDING REQUESTED IS  165,000 WITH A TRIBAL MATCH OF  10,000.

BRISTOL BAY NATIVE CORPORATION  BBNC , THE ALASKA NATIVE CORPORATION THAT REPRESENTS MORE THAN 11,000 NATIVE SHAREHOLDERS WHO ARE FROM OR HAVE ANCESTRAL TIES TO THE BRISTOL BAY REGION OF ALASKA, IS REQUESTING  496,112 FROM THE TEDC PROGRAM FOR THE PROJECT ELECTRIC UTILITY COLLABORATION  DEVELOPING CAPACITY AMONGST SMALL MICROGRIDS IN BRISTOL BAY  THIS PROJECT WILL DEVELOP CAPACITY AROUND OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE OF BRISTOL BAY UTILITIES AND READY THOSE UTILITIES FOR A TRANSITION TOWARDS RENEWABLE ENERGY INTEGRATION  THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH TARGETED CAPACITY BUILDING BY SPECIALIZED CONTRACTED SUPPORT FOR THREE TO FIVE COMMUNITIES IN THE BRISTOL BAY REGION  DANIEL CHEYETTE, SENIOR VP OF LANDS AND NATURAL RESOURCES AT BBNC IS THE DESIGNATED TRIBAL PROJECT LEAD  THE PROPOSED PROJECT BUILDS ON TEDC FUNDED PHASE ONE WORK, WHICH STUDIED THE IMPACT AND POTENTIAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR COST SAVINGS BY CREATING A COLLABORATIVE APPROACH TO MANAGING THESE SMALL INDEPENDENT UTILITIES  THE RURAL VILLAGE ELECTRIC UTILITIES IN BRISTOL BAY ARE EXTREMELY SMALL, TYPICALLY ISLANDED MICROGRIDS THAT OPERATE INDEPENDENTLY AND RELY ON IMPORTED DIESEL FUEL THAT MUST BE SHIPPED OR FLOWN IN  UTILITIES ARE EXPERIENCING SHARED CHALLENGES, INCLUDING AGING INFRASTRUCTURE  EXPENSIVE AND IMPORTED FUEL PURCHASES WITH CHALLENGING DELIVERY SCHEDULES  A LIMITED SKILLED LOCAL WORKFORCE  RELIANCE ON IMPORTED EXPERTISE  AND A LACK OF STRUCTURE TO EFFECTIVELY OPERATE AND MAINTAIN BOTH THE BUSINESS SIDE AND THE INFRASTRUCTURE SIDE OF A POWER UTILITY  THE RESULT IS ENERGY COSTS THAT ARE EXCEEDINGLY HIGHOFTEN FIVE OR EVEN EIGHT TIMES THE NATIONAL AVERAGEIN A REGION WITH VERY LOW INCOMES  PHASE ONE OF THIS PROJECT BROUGHT TOGETHER REGIONAL PARTNERS IN AN ENERGY STEERING COMMITTEE TO STUDY AND ULTIMATELY CONCEPTUALIZE A REGIONAL ORGANIZATION TO SUPPORT UTILITIES  SPECIFICALLY, THE BRISTOL BAY ENERGY STEERING COMMITTEE  STEERING COMMITTEE  RECOMMENDED A SECOND PHASE OF OUR WORK THAT FORMS A REGIONAL UTILITY COLLABORATIVE TO SUPPORT UTILITIES THROUGHOUT THE REGION  THE STEERING COMMITTEE CAME TO THIS CONCLUSION AFTER REVIEWING BASELINE DATA FOR UTILITIES ACROSS THE REGION THAT SUGGESTED COST SAVING OPPORTUNITIES EXIST FOR MANY UTILITIES THROUGH IMPROVED BOOKKEEPING, MORE REGULAR REGULATORY REPORTING, AND BY APPROPRIATELY ADJUSTING RATES  FURTHER, THE STEERING COMMITTEE RECOGNIZED THERE ARE HUGE OPPORTUNITIES TO IMPROVE UTILITY PERFORMANCE THROUGH STANDARDIZING OPERATIONS AND PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE AND CONDUCTING DETAILED PLANNING FOR LONGER TERM INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS WITH A PLANNED TRANSITION TO INTEGRATING RENEWABLE ENERGY  THE STEERING COMMITTEES PHASE ONE WORK DEMONSTRATED THAT, THROUGH COLLABORATION, CAPACITY DEVELOPMENT, AND SHARING OF SERVICES, THE SMALL AND ISOLATED UTILITIES COULD REALIZE MEANINGFUL COST SAVINGS, IMPROVE INFRASTRUCTURE, AND MOVE TOWARDS A FUTURE WITH HIGH PENETRATION RENEWABLE INTEGRATION  THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROJECT ARE TO  WORK COLLABORATIVELY WITH THREE TO FIVE COMMUNITIES IN THE REGION TO DEVELOP STANDARD BUSINESS, MANAGEMENT, OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE PROCEDURES FOR THEIR SMALL ELECTRIC UTILITIES  BUILD LOCAL WORKFORCE CAPACITY, AND CONDUCT AN INFRASTRUCTURE ASSESSMENT THAT BECOMES A ROADMAP FOR THE CAPITAL PROJECTS NECESSARY TO INTEGRATE RENEWABLE ENERGY ALTERNATIVES INTO THEIR UTILITY INFRASTRUCTURES  THE OUTCOMES INCLUDE  REALIZE IMMEDIATE COST SAVINGS  DEVELOP LOCAL CAPACITY TO MORE EFFECTIVELY AND EFFICIENTLY MANAGE SMALL INDEPENDENT UTILITIES  INCREASE COLLABORATION AMONGST UTILITIES IN THE REGION TO REALIZE ECONOMIES OF SCALE, SHARE RESOURCES, AND BUILD INTER UTILITY SUPPORT   DEVELOP AN INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENT PLAN THAT WILL TURN INTO FUNDED PROJECTS  AND BEGIN A LONG TERM, TRANSITION TOWARDS RENEWABLE ENERGY THAT WILL INCREASE ENERGY INDEPENDENCE AND RESILIENCE
